Techniques - JSON

Created:2018-03-12  Last modified:2018-03-12

  • Introduction
  • Java JSON Libraries
  • References

  1. Introduction

    JSON (JavaScript Object Notation): lightweight of XML

    Example

        {
        "key":"value",
        "list":[
            "value-1",
            "value-2"
        ],
        "bool":true,
        "num":1.2,
        "list-2":[
            true,
            -10,
            "mixed"
        ]
    }
    1. string, bool, num, [], {}
    2. The key must be a string
    3. data within a list can be different types.
    4. except the last item, all item ends with comma,

  2. Java JSON Libraries

    Java 9 has natively supported JSON. It provided an API.

    Third party json libraries.

    1. json.simple: faster at small file(1KB) and big file(100MB+)
    2. gson: fastest at small files, slowest at big files
    3. Jackson: fastest at big files, slowest at small files
    4. JSONP:middle
